issue.title: [NETBEANS-6599] Do not throw a CompletionFailure for empty java.lang package outside of java.base.

labels.name: Java
labels.description: [ci] enable extra Java tests (java.completion, java.source.base, java.hints, refactoring.java, form)

issue.body:
`NBClassFinder` throws a customized `CompletionFailure` when empty `java.lang` is seen. This is to prevent hard `Abort` later in case there are no system classes. But, the exception is also thrown when the `java.lang` that is being completed is not in the `java.base` module, which leads to false positives. So, the proposal is to limit the CF to only cases where the package is from java.base.


closes #6599


---
**^Add meaningful description above**

comment.body:
Thanks @lahodaj 

Out of interest, do you have an idea what might have changed in JDK 21 that seems to be triggering this?  Or does the test code fail on earlier JDKs too?  My one concern is whether this is a symptom of a problem somewhere else that needs looking at?

I believe I have corrected all of my id10t errors.

Microsoft have depreciated internet explorer, do I need to add any thing to deal with this?
Does microsofts new edge browser get identified as a chrome clone browser?

Here's the depreciation announcement link
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/lifecycle/announcements/internet-explorer-11-end-of-support

When I backed up my fork before deleting and reforking netbeans I've somehow managed to grab the previous code configuration for this function :tired_face:

Now fixed again

comment.body:
I think I was in to much of a rush to resubmit the pull request that I managed to missed this

The previous method tries to work out the default browser by looking in HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT at .html, the new method finds it by looking in HKEY_CURRENT_USER at the userChoice for https.

issue.title: NB20rc2 Crashes the Whole Desktop on Wayland with FlatLaf Window Decorations

labels.name: kind:bug
labels.description: Bug report or fix

labels.name: needs:triage
labels.description: Requires attention from one of the committers

issue.body:
### Apache NetBeans version

Apache NetBeans 20 release candidate

### What happened

I've been testing Wayland for a few days, since upgraded my main Laptop to 23.10, in order to test #6587.
On NB20-rc1 was running fine, except the mentioned issue (however I have not tested that really hard).

After yesterday drop of rc2, I've checked #6587 again, which is really solved, however after a few popups (code completion, context menus), my whole desktop hangs and I have to reboot my system.

This only happened in the combination of using Wayland and FlatLaF window decorations enabled.

I'm continuing the testing, feeding more details here as they come.

### How to reproduce

Use NetBeans in Wayland (XWayland) with FlatLaF when the Window Decorations feature is switched on.

### Did this work correctly in an earlier version?

No / Don't know

### Operating System

Ubuntu 23.10

### JDK

OpenJDK 21

### Apache NetBeans packaging

Apache NetBeans Snap Package

### Anything else

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit a pull request?

No

issue.title: NB20rc2 Crashes the Whole Desktop on Wayland with FlatLaf Window Decorations

labels.name: kind:bug
labels.description: Bug report or fix

labels.name: needs:triage
labels.description: Requires attention from one of the committers

issue.body:
### Apache NetBeans version

Apache NetBeans 20 release candidate

### What happened

I've been testing Wayland for a few days, since upgraded my main Laptop to 23.10, in order to test #6587.
On NB20-rc1 was running fine, except the mentioned issue (however I have not tested that really hard).

After yesterday drop of rc2, I've checked #6587 again, which is really solved, however after a few popups (code completion, context menus), my whole desktop hangs and I have to reboot my system.

This only happened in the combination of using Wayland and FlatLaF window decorations enabled.

I'm continuing the testing, feeding more details here as they come.

### How to reproduce

Use NetBeans in Wayland (XWayland) with FlatLaF when the Window Decorations feature is switched on.

### Did this work correctly in an earlier version?

No / Don't know

### Operating System

Ubuntu 23.10

### JDK

OpenJDK 21

### Apache NetBeans packaging

Apache NetBeans Snap Package

### Anything else

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit a pull request?

No

comment.body:
Well, it happened with me two times this morning, not ever since. Tested on another computer of mine with Ubuntu 23.04 and 23.10 again. Nothing. 

Further research indicates, that there could be an issue in the `amdgpu` driver in Linux Kernel 6.5.x which Ubuntu 23.10 uses. We had a Kernel update today, i hope that one fixed this for me, closing.

issue.title: The list of tests should include TestNG tests.
issue.body:
Please see here:
https://github.com/oracle/javavscode/issues/28

The test indexer uses providers to detect tests, and the provider for TestNG tests seems to be missing. So, this PR adds the provider.


---
**^Add meaningful description above**

By opening a pull request you confirm that, unless explicitly stated otherwise, the changes -

 - are all your own work, and you have the right to contribute them.
 - are contributed solely under the terms and conditions of the Apache License 2.0 (see section 5 of the license for more information).

If you're a first time contributor, see the Contributing guidelines for more information.

If you're a committer, please label the PR before pressing "Create pull request" so that the right test jobs can run.

comment.body: Makes sense. Still I would think it’s a pretty big issue for net brand users as well. The OpenJDK uses a lot of TrstNG tests.

issue.title: Error notification - Symbol$CompletionFailure: cannot find symbol java.lang

labels.name: kind:bug
labels.description: Bug report or fix

labels.name: Java
labels.description: [ci] enable extra Java tests (java.completion, java.source.base, java.hints, refactoring.java, form)

labels.name: needs:triage
labels.description: Requires attention from one of the committers

issue.body:
### Apache NetBeans version

Apache NetBeans 20 release candidate

### What happened

Testing 20-rc1 on some other work projects, and consistently seeing error notifications with `Symbol$CompletionFailure` cannot find symbol `package java.lang`. Stack trace seems to often show this in `NPECheck` hint.

<details><summary>Full stack trace ...</summary>

### Did this work correctly in an earlier version?

Apache NetBeans 19

### Operating System

Ubuntu 22.04

### JDK

JDK 21 (Zulu)

### Apache NetBeans packaging

Apache NetBeans binary zip

comment.body:
So, under normal circumstances, this code was meant to throw a meaningful CompletionFailure, which would produce a meaningful error, when java.lang does not contain anything (as opposed to normal javac behavior which will simply stop the compilation). Normally, CF should be get outside of javac, but there is apparently a hole here for ModuleSymbol.getEnclosedElements. And, apparently, javac thinks there's an empty java.lang package in the given module (which could be potentially caused by multiple things).

I think I'll need to try to:
 - fix ModuleSymbol.getEnclosedElements is javac (at least as long as I can find a way to reproduce)
 - fix NBClassFinder to only throw new CF for java.lang from java.base.

issue.title: NB20rc2 Crashes the Whole Desktop on Wayland with FlatLaf Window Decorations

labels.name: kind:bug
labels.description: Bug report or fix

labels.name: needs:triage
labels.description: Requires attention from one of the committers

issue.body:
### Apache NetBeans version

Apache NetBeans 20 release candidate

### What happened

I've been testing Wayland for a few days, since upgraded my main Laptop to 23.10, in order to test #6587.
On NB20-rc1 was running fine, except the mentioned issue (however I have not tested that really hard).

After yesterday drop of rc2, I've checked #6587 again, which is really solved, however after a few popups (code completion, context menus), my whole desktop hangs and I have to reboot my system.

This only happened in the combination of using Wayland and FlatLaF window decorations enabled.

I'm continuing the testing, feeding more details here as they come.

### How to reproduce

Use NetBeans in Wayland (XWayland) with FlatLaF when the Window Decorations feature is switched on.

### Did this work correctly in an earlier version?

No / Don't know

### Operating System

Ubuntu 23.10

### JDK

OpenJDK 21

### Apache NetBeans packaging

Apache NetBeans Snap Package

### Anything else

_No response_

### Are you willing to submit a pull request?

No

comment.body:
It seem multi and or external monitor setup is needed to reproduce the issue.

Probably even even rc1 was affected, though I was solely on my laptop display, till got back home.  Still testing.

comment.body:
I am getting mixed messages from this PR: milestone is set to 20 while it is building on master. I was about to test the devbuild but will stop since it is not the right branch (assuming it is supposed to go into delivery?).

I would personally prefer the lowest risk approach and revert the changes and prepare a new PR for NB 21 where they have some time to stabilize. For future integrations of non-trivial PRs which have possible risks of side effects, please state what kind of testing has been done before integration (example: #6597, #6533). This should be part of the review process.

And I think we all can agree that we shouldn't integrate non-trival PRs anymore if they miss the deadline. NB 20 will now essentially have one week less of maven testing since RC2 can't be used for that. (its also not the first time that this happened as we know)

I would also invite everyone to the netbeans channel on apache slack again, which is quite useful esp during the release phase and can be used to answer questions and get opinions quickly if time is short.

issue.title: Be more friendly on 'runSingle' when 'run' task is missing.

labels.name: Gradle
labels.description: [ci] enable "build tools" tests

issue.body:
While #6003 was addressing issues with the Gradle setup of running single classes, the backward compatibility, providing a `runSingle` task throwing an exception in the absence of `run` task is not nice. This PR adds back the `runSingle` functionality in those cases.

Fixes: #6586

comment.body: I can confirm that this also fixes the problem I had with my real project (not just the example)

comment.body: cc/ @jlahoda - what are the possible causes of `java.lang` not being found in `NbClassFinder::getCompleter`?  I seem to be getting notifications from the code you added in #2947 a lot running on JDK 21 only, both with NB20 release candidates, and with another project based on NB17.
